# This is my first notebook and my key aims were

1. To begin visualizing data in the form of a heatmap in which anyone can follow and
2. Answer the question: ***Did Covid have a notable effect on Crime in London through the past 24 months?***

It uses seaborn which is an extremely versatile package and I hope you will want to experiment with further. 

A useful tutorial that I drew the code from is located [here](https://www.kaggle.com/learn/data-visualization). It's very informative and assumes no prior knowledge. It provides just enough to get you started which is great! 

The data is taken from my [police crime dataset](https://www.kaggle.com/benjaminfox/london-crime-records-2019-08-01-to-2021-07-31) and has been summarised in google sheets before re-importing here. This is notebook is simply for people such as myself starting out.

Okay, pretty cool. We can begin to see some patterns more clearly. 

There seems to be a two notable drops across the boroughs, one in Mar-Apr 2020 and another in Jan-Feb 2021. This is delineated by the two dark plum columns.

I suggest a possible reason for this. 

On 26 March 2020 the UK lockdown started in relation to COVID ([source](https://www.instituteforgovernment.org.uk/sites/default/files/timeline-lockdown-web.pdf)). Also, the third lockdown happened in January 2021.
